The human genome does not directly describe physical appearance. Instead, it contains genetic information that can influence physical traits through complex interactions with environmental factors. While modern methods like CRISPR can be used to edit the genome, it is important to note that altering the genome can have unintended consequences and is not currently used for cosmetic purposes. Here is some sample Python code that demonstrates how to use the CRISPR-Cas9 system to edit a gene:
```python
import cas9
# Define the target DNA sequence
target_sequence = "
